content.en: DDoS defense with machine learning: Researchers have been investigating how to detect and defend against Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks in software-defined networking (SDN) environments. They have found that machine learning algorithms, such as K-Means, KNN, Decision Tree, Naïve Bayes, and Deep Learning models, can be used to automatically detect and mitigate these attacks. By using these algorithms, they are able to analyze network traffic and identify abnormal patterns that indicate a DDoS attack, allowing for timely response and protection of the network.
content.da: DDoS-beskyttelse med maskinlæring: Forskere har undersøgt, hvordan man kan opdage og forsvare sig mod Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) angreb i software-defineret netværk (SDN) miljøer. De har fundet ud af, at maskinlæringsalgoritmer, såsom K-Means, KNN, Decision Tree, Naïve Bayes og Deep Learning modeller, kan bruges til automatisk at opdage og afbøde disse angreb. Ved at bruge disse algoritmer kan de analysere netværkstrafik og identificere unormale mønstre, der indikerer et DDoS-angreb, hvilket muliggør en rettidig respons og beskyttelse af netværket.
